body.p: Beriah Magoffin Esqr Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, to the Sheriff of Logan County greeting. Whereas Nelson, a negro slave the property of Edmund Ayers was convicted of the crime of murder and sentenced to be he executed by hanging until dead by the Logan Equity and Criminal Court, and the 13th day of September 1861 ^was^ fixed for the day of Execution_ And whereas the said sentence was respited and the 15th of Novr 1861 fixed by the Governor as the day for execution, and whereas the Judgment of death has not been executed on the day appointed therefore upon the said slave Nelson form ^for^ causes certified under th by an order of said court, which order is in the words and figures following.

Now therefore, you are commanded to precu Be it known that the day of 1862 is, in obedience to the laws of the land in such cases made and provided, fixed and appointed
as the day of Execution in said case And the Sheriff of Logan county and is commanded on said last named day to do execution of said Judgment and sentence
Done at Frankfort on the day of 1862 and in the year of the Commonwealth under the Seal of the State

By the Governor
Secty of State
